_comment: Created by EFisher on 17/02/2016 18:39:04 using v2.7
title: Is the number of calls responsible for the standard breach in the month?
analysis_commentary:
This can also be seen when you look at the national performance against the 8 minute target against the volume of calls. There does appear to be an inverse relationship between the total number of calls and the percentage that can be responded to within the eight minutes.

However, the total number of calls doesn't appear to be the sole reason for the breach of the national standard in a given month, as breaches are not always associated with increased call activity and increased call activity doesn't always result in a breach. Although there could be a tipping point where over 250,000 calls nationally leads to a national breach in the target.

Further investigation of what is happening to cause breaches would be needed, as it is not down solely to activity in response to ambulance calls that are classed as life-threatening.
